column1: Wishing everyone a safe and healthy holiday weekend. I hope you’ll join me in showing our deep gratitude to our essential workers and health care professionals on the frontlines by doing everything we can to stay safe – including wearing a mask and staying socially distant.

Always great to chat with The Pitch about the biggest issues facing our community - from COVID relief to the best barbecue sauce in town and whether or not Patrick Mahomes should run for President (maybe one day but right now we need him where he is).   https://t.co/voEP6c2P5F

Last week I had the chance to help deliver groceries to folks in #KS03 during a community food bank hosted by Roeland Park UMC. The need for food security programs has increased drastically due to the coronavirus - and I’m continuing to push for the relief our families need. https://t.co/0BQcLefk2J

At a time when people across the country are calling out for real leadership this Administration is walking away. It's outrageous and it's wrong.   I'll continue to push for bipartisan COVID relief — Kansans lives and livelihoods depend on it. https://t.co/Sp0ei4iG88

The coronavirus is not over — and neither are the challenges that Kansans face. I'm continuing to push for bipartisan relief to get help to those who need it most.   And as always make sure to wear your mask and practice social distancing. https://t.co/wbYspFi9yn

A4: COVID-19 has laid bare so many harsh realities that exist in our country - including health disparities. These are complex systemic issues that must be addressed. In the short term we must increase testing support Community Health Centers & expand access to health care. https://t.co/AjGMMMe3rs

When the coronavirus hit and our economy slowed Kansas businesses took a hit. Yet Wall Street’s booming. It shows the deck is stacked.  That's why I'm working to get COVID aid to small businesses keeping Kansans on the job. Watch: https://t.co/nzMjntLjWA

I'm proud to be endorsed by the U.S. Chamber.   I'll continue to fight for pro-growth policies that will help move our economy forward particularly in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic. #KS03 https://t.co/chiDTfowLE

BIG NEWS! We are up on TV today!   Coronavirus has impacted how we live learn and work. But as the virus surged and our economy slowed down I knew I couldn't.   Watch our new ad and then chip in $5 to help keep us on air --> https://t.co/iwkB7Rp7LM #KS03 https://t.co/i6rIWv5BrW
Imagine how many more lives could have been saved if the President spent as much time working to stop the coronavirus as he has working to stop the vote. https://t.co/OICh2SoOBO

But we have a lot of work left to do. And that's why I'm running for reelection.   Our country is in crisis.   The coronavirus showed that our economy and healthcare system need to change. I’m committed to making sure those changes help hardworking Kansans not special interests.

Once again this Administration is attempting to downplay the severity of this virus and obscure the facts. This unprecedented move will hurt our ability to fight COVID-19 and undermines the very institutions tasked with keeping us safe. https://t.co/14uYHCepzv

The COVID-19 pandemic has devastated our community and country. I joined @KCURUpToDate to discuss the need for legislation to address the most pressing issues facing #KS03 - from expanding Medicaid to supporting our state & local governments. https://t.co/grfmXWEmIX

As we saw in elections across the country yesterday it's essential that voters can safely access the ballot box during the COVID-19 pandemic. No one should have to choose between their health and their vote.   https://t.co/ACrxyX5lSV

100000 lives have been lost to the coronavirus in the United States alone — a tragedy of unimaginable scale. We mourn for the lives lost for the families grieving and for our nation during this gut-wrenching time.  https://t.co/B9y1O49ex6

It's not too late to sign up and join Let America Vote Founder @JasonKander End Citizens United and Let America Vote President @Tiffany_Muller and me for a virtual roundtable on voting rights during the coronavirus pandemic.   Register here --> https://t.co/rWlwiRK2km https://t.co/lA1qGoBHYO

Join Let America Vote Founder @JasonKander End Citizens United and Let America Vote President @Tiffany_Muller and me for a virtual roundtable on voting rights during the coronavirus pandemic.   Register & ask your questions here --> https://t.co/axBLRSC4AO https://t.co/hjYUvNN4WK

The nationwide shortage of medical supplies is hurting our ability to fight COVID-19 and endangering those on frontline.   I introduced the SUPPLIES Act to help small businesses produce these items promote U.S. manufacturing and prevent price gouging.  https://t.co/91swteUop2

No one should be denied coverage based on preexisting conditions. But if the Trump Administration is successful in its lawsuit to repeal the ACA that's exactly what will happen. And the coronavirus pandemic is showing just how devastating that would be.  https://t.co/YT007xdRow

The coronavirus is exacerbating a lot of the issues tribal communities and Native people have faced for far too long. I spoke with @Lawrence last night about why that is and what we're doing to help address these issues. Watch: https://t.co/rFTsqxGGA7

Even during our most challenging times I've seen our community come together and help neighbors in need. So if you're able to please consider donating to the Kansas City Regional COVID-19 Response and Recovery Fund.    We are #OneKC. More info here --> https://t.co/EMxjxo3oOO https://t.co/7OojiXIfXI

ICYMI: I spoke with @965TheBuzz last week about the coronavirus including how we can get out accurate information to folks and help workers and small businesses affected by this public health emergency. Listen here →  https://t.co/5PPt3BbOHo

The coronavirus is jeopardizing both the public health & financial security of people in this country. Any economic package that Congress puts forward must protect workers and families provide relief for small businesses & establish clear accountability. https://t.co/wAaD8IZPJf

It's called the 2019 novel coronavirus or COVID-19. Calling it the "Chinese virus" does nothing but add to the xenophobia Asian-Americans are already experiencing and make it harder to contain the disease.   Let's lead with compassion instead of division and fear.

The House passed the bipartisan #FamiliesFirst act to address the health & economic impact of the coronavirus.   Now the Senate needs to pass this package immediately.   Families are counting on us — this can’t wait. https://t.co/QOgIeRjfYw

We all have a role to play in reducing the spread of COVID-19 and that's why it's essential we rely on accurate up to date information. Visit the CDC or @KDHE websites for information about prevention symptoms and what to do if you are feeling sick. https://t.co/AlJKjITAZT
